description: From chloro- +‎ cruor +‎ -in (see also cruorin). Named by British zoologist Ray Lankester in 1868.

entries.meaning: (biochemistry, organic chemistry) A green respiratory pigment found in many annelids.
examples: Later it was shown that the α-bands of the pyridine haemochromogens of both cytochrome a and chlorocruorin resemble each other closely (Keilin, 1933 a).
